metadata.title: CVE-2024-26694 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:iwlwifi: fix double-free bug The storage for the TLV PC register datawasn't done like all the other storage in the drv->fw area, which iscleared at the end of deallocation. Therefore, the freeing must also bedone differently, explicitly NULL'ing it out after the free, sinceotherwise there's a nasty double-free bug here if a file fails to loadafter this has been parsed, and we get another free later (e.g. because noother file exists.) Fix that by adding the missing NULL assignment.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-aws - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-ibm - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-25-lowlatency - 6.8.0-25.25.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-25-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-25.25.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1004-oracle - 6.8.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1004-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1001-raspi - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
